question: In the diagram shown, the Zener diode has a reverse breakdown voltage of <katex>$V_{Z}$</katex>. The current through the load resistance <katex>$R_{L}$</katex> is <katex>$I_{L}$</katex>. The current through the Zener diode is
images/e4d3c2b1-a1b2-4c3d-8e9f-000000000023.png
explanation: By Kirchhoff's current law at the node, <katex>$I = I_Z + I_L$</katex>.
Therefore, Zener current <katex>$I_Z = I - I_L = (\frac{V_o - V_Z}{R_S}) - I_L$</katex>.
